apic_versions.description: APIC Releases.  Select the Version that Most Closely matches your version.

files.description: Files to Pull down from the Easy ACI Project.

ndo_versions.description: Nexus Dashboard Orchestrotor Releases.  Select the Version that Most Closely matches your version.

vlan_pool.description: Name of the VLAN Pool to Associate to the Domain.
Name of the VLAN Pool to Associate to the Domain.

infra_vlan.description: Flag to Include the Infrastructure VLAN.

auto_max_speed.description: Auto-max-speed for object interface FC policy.

fill_pattern.description: Fill Pattern for native FC ports.

port_mode.description: In which mode Ports should be used.

receive_buffer_credit.description: Receive buffer credits for native FC ports.

trunk_mode.description: Trunking on/off for native FC ports.

QinQ.description: To enable or disable an interface for Dot1q Tunnel or Q-in-Q encapsulation modes

reflective_relay.description: Enable or disable reflective relay for ports that consume the policy.

auto_negotiation.description: Policy auto negotiation for object fabric if pol.

emi_retrain.description: The electromagnetic interference (EMI) retrain feature filters any noise on a link due to electromagnetic interference, and retrains the link to avoid a link flap. Enable EMI retrain if your data center environment has a lot of EMI noise.

forwarding_error_correction.description: Forwarding Error Correction (FEC) is a method of obtaining error control in data transmission over an unreliable or noisy channel in which the source (transmitter) encodes the data in a redundant way using Error Correcting Code and the destination (receiver) recognizes it and corrects the errors without needing a retransmission.

link_debounce_interval.description: The interface policy administrative port link debounce interval. Enables the debounce timer for physical interface ports and sets it for a specified amount of time in milliseconds. The debounce timer is disabled if you specify a value of 0.

port_delay_when_coming_up.description: The time in milliseconds that the DFE tuning is delayed when a port is coming up. The delay is used to help avoid CRC errors during link bringup. You should set the delay only as required; in most cases, you do not need to set a delay.

speed.description: The interface policy administrative port speed. The data transfer rate for the port should match the destination to which the port is linked. The administrative speed can be changed only for certain ports, and not all speeds are available on all systems. For more information, see the Hardware Installation Guide for your fabric interconnect.

receive_state.description: The reception of LLDP packets on an interface.

transmit_state.description: The transmission of LLDP packets on an interface.

fast_select_hot_standby_ports.description: Configures fast select for hot standby ports. Enabling this feature will allow fast selection of a hot standby port when last active port in the port-channel is going down.

graceful_convergence.description: Configures port-channel LACP graceful convergence. Disable this only with LACP ports connected to a Non-Nexus peer. Disabling this with Nexus peer can lead to port suspension.

load_defer_member_ports.description: Configures the load-balancing algorithm for port channels that applies to the entire device or to only one module.

minimum_number_of_links.description: Minimum number of links in port channel.

suspend_individual_port.description: LACP sets a port to the suspended state if it does not receive an LACP bridge protocol data unit (BPDU) from the peer ports in a port channel. This can cause some servers to fail to boot up as they require LACP to logically bring up the port.

symmetric_hashing.description: Bidirectional traffic is forced to use the same physical interface and each physical interface in the port channel is effectively mapped to a set of flows.

maximum_endpoints.description: The maximum number of endpoints that can be learned on the interface.

port_security_timeout.description: The delay time before MAC learning is re-enabled.

filter.description: The interface level control that enables the BPDU filter for extended chassis ports.

guard.description: The interface level control that enables the BPDU guard for extended chassis ports.

copp_interface_policy.description: Name of the Control Plane Policing Interface Policy.

data_plane_policing_ingress.description: Name of the ingress Data Plane Policing Policy.
